name: Hong Kong Phooey
overview: Hong Kong Phooey (full title: Hong Kong Phooey: No. 1 Super Guy), is a platform game that was developed by PAL Developments, Enigma Variations and Twilight for Hi-Tec Software, and released on the systems of the Sinclair ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64 and Commodore Amiga in 1990; it is based on the Hanna-Barbera television series of the same name, which originally aired in 1974 (and was one of their shortest-lived TV cartoons, given that it only ran for thirteen episodes).
